docs.text: carolco pictures and dutch director paul verhoeven ( robocop ) came together to create the 1990 mega hit that is total recall .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is a masterpiece of sets , action , and special effects .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: action and science fiction just don't get any better than this !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story involves a construction worker named douglas quaid ( arnold schwarzenegger ) who lives on earth with his beautiful wife lori ( sharon stone ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: quaid is obsessed with mars and decides to go with the second best choice ; a brain implant ( fake memory ) of a two week vacation on mars .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while being implanted a memory cap is triggered and the doctors realize that quaid's memory has previously been erased .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now the people who did it are after him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: quaid must find out who he really is and why these people want him dead .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the plot unfolds at a rapid pace explaining itself through great action , special effects , and twist after mind-boggling twist .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it grabs you and never lets go !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this film is a winner from beginning to end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the plot is superb ; combining the best elements of science fiction and psychological mystery to create a rip-roaring saga .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: schwarzenegger gives his best performance ever , and the supporting cast is good too .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the action and stunts are terrific .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the sets are huge and elaborate with a lot of attention payed to detail .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the music and sound effects are perfect for the film and really add a certain level of impact to the action .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the make-up effects by rob bottin ( the howling , the thing , and robocop ) are top notch , not to mention extremely outlandish .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the visual effects by dream quest ( the abyss ) and industrial light and magic ( star wars trilogy , jurassic park , and terminator 2 ) are phenomenal !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the visuals had such a state of the art " slickness " that they won an oscar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: of course the film isn't always realistic ; it's more fiction than science .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for example , it is true that a body won't explode in the vacuum of space but in total recall they do .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: who cares ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: movies are supposed to entertain .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and in my opinion this film achieves an entertainment level in film that is so terrific , it may be impossible to beat .
docs.label: positive
